intro: Marginaria microlepis, commonly known as the small-leaved marginaria, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its delicate, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in umbels, typical of the family. Marginaria microlepis is often found in rocky or sandy soils, thriving in well-drained environments. It is relatively low-maintenance and can be grown in gardens with adequate sunlight and drainage.
